intro: Nigritella rhellicani subsp. cenisia, commonly known as the Cenisia subsp. of the Nigritella genus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers, which can be pink or white, are often clustered in inflorescences and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
